intro: Randia kunstleri, commonly known as the velvetleaf randia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. It produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Randia kunstleri is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
